numbered_ace_sentences: 2. The graph focuses on the distribution of admission advantages at some elite colleges.
3. The graph shows a claim about admission likelihood.
4. A rich applicant is 7 times more likely to be admitted than a poor applicant.
5. Legacy status can affect the chance of admission to a college.
6. The income of parents can affect the chance of admission to a college.
8. The graph emphasizes the distribution rate of legacy admission advantages.
9. The graph helps to conclude something about the rate of college students.
10. I wonder why the financial status of a person can dictate the education of the person.
11. This topic relates to my community.
12. Most students in my town struggle financially.
13. If a student struggles financially then it is harder for the student to get into a college.
14. The financial status of a student can discourage the student from going to college.
15. The headline is: No money and no education.
